ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Solving problems. Clarified some concepts that confused me before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great course in its current form.
This is a standard course of good quality. Maybe we can have more examples solved in class.
The course was taught well, but the syllabus could do with an update; some topics seemed far more relevant and interesting than others.

The class presented a lot of interesting material in a mathematically rigorous way. However, material was often presented with very little physical insight - derivations involved mindless algebraic manipulations without development of intuition.
The homeworks and the exams correlated well. Lecture did not
I felt the homework problems were very helpful in understanding what was taught in class, though certain sections were covered perhaps too thoroughly in the homeworks.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is helpful for those who study classical physical systems.
